Articles.Content:
So I would like to build a lander. and I would like to use as small as engines as possible.. Now on Kerban the lander doesn't even get lifted by the rockets, but this is set for the mun.. Can I figure out if it works there?

I would need to know the mass (which I can find out)

Then I need to know the gravity of the mun

and then figure out what "engine max power) is..

Like if a engine max power is 250.. does that mean under Kerban gravity it'll lift 250 mass?

Some help would be great. Thanks!

Check the KSP wiki to find the gravity on each planetary body (google it, that's what I always do).

Engine thrust is in kN, and masses are in tones (1000 kg). Divide the power by the mass to get the acceleration: 250 kN can move 250 tonnes at 1m/s^2, which is nowhere near enough on Kerbin or even on Mun, but plenty on Minmus.

You should probably get Kerbin engineering system (KES) and the subassembly loader. KES can give you thrust-to-weight ratios for all the different bodies so you can size your lander for your target planet. Subassembly loader will allow you to save your lander and attach it to another spacecraft rather than re-build it.
